thread.title: Danny Dyer gets worked up about Barbies, magnets and the school run in Channel 4's Parenting for Idiots
thread.title_full: Danny Dyer gets worked up about Barbies, magnets and the school run in Channel 4's Parenting for Idiots

author: Suchandrika Chakrabarti
title: Danny Dyer gets worked up about Barbies, magnets and the school run in Channel 4's Parenting for Idiots
text:
TV Danny Dyer gets worked up about Barbies, magnets and the school run in Channel 4's Parenting for Idiots The father-of-three Eastenders hearthrob looks hopelessly pained as he describes all the aspects of parenting that confound him, including homework and building doll's houses Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch: Hilarious Danny Dyer talks about parenting Share this video Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Danny Dyer has a lot to get off his chest on his upcoming episode of Parenting for Idiots. 
The man who plays Eastenders pub landlord Mick Carter has three children he dotes upon in reali life: daughters Danni, 20 and Sunnie, 9, as well as a three-year-old son named Arty. 
He talks about wanting to have a son after two daughters because he found getting bikinis onto Barbie dolls impossible - "Honestly, it's graft mate." 
He also accidentally reveals the truth about Father Christmas in front of at least one watching daughter. Danny Dyer is totally flummoxed by doll's houses, and also their swimwear (Photo: Channel 4) Danny CANNOT get his 'nut' round homework. We think that means 'head'. (Photo: Channel 4) Read More 
Homework leaves Danny almost incandescent with confusion: "I was like, I can't do it! I cannot get my nut around it." 
He cites one particular piece of take-home study, which asked his child to "Name seven magnets." 
Danny almost melts down at this, claiming: "There's only one, there's a fridge magnet and no other magnet!" Danny can't stand the small talk he has to make on the school run (Photo: Channel 4) Read More 
It seems unlikely that this would be a homework question, so it's likely that Danny's remembering the question wrongly - making his meltdown all the funnier. 
He then demands that the interviewer names seven magnets. Alright, mate. 
Lastly, Danny lays into the pure horror of the school run, where making small talk is mandatory. He hates that. 
Poor Danny. Can you name seven magnets? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
